Thanks for having us and continuing to educate the public #RealTimeVaccineChat https://t.co/7L5ZYRF6S4
A10: I am most curious about when Novavax might become available. Wonder where it is in the system as it would be great to have another vaccine available. #RealTimeVaccineChat
@SHANINAKNIGHTON @RealTimeCOVID19 I wish people got a day off so they could get vaccinated - a vaccine holiday to help address this issue #RealTimeVaccineChat
RT @AndrewPaviaMD: A9 Agree with everything that's been said about improving access and convenience, but also it is easy to transport and s
RT @JGPharmD: @PergamIC Agreed. Even with the negative impressive left by the JJ vaccine pause, there will still be plenty of people who e

there have been a number of people who want a single dose vaccine. Hard for those who work full time, those who work night shift, have large families, etc. to get time away - so a single dose shot can be helpful. #RealTimeVaccineChat https://t.co/YTeBtoQ9R0

Can't compare efficacy from trials as they were done at different times - rates were higher for vector vaccines trials ( in areas w/variants). There are all effective - although AZ appeared to be slightly less effective against B.1.351 #RealTimeVaccineChat #RealTimeVaccineChat https://t.co/1d1ATrPh5e
RT @AndrewPaviaMD: The Oxford-AZ vaccine has pretty similar efficacy overall Note that the studies in different settings and times. One d

A6: It is also important to remember full protection doesn't occur until 2 weeks after second dose of mRNA vaccines, and 4 weeks after JJ dose So consider the timing when you consider getting together too #RealTimeVaccineChat
RT @AndrewPaviaMD: A6 Being with a few people who you know are fully vaccinated is different than being with unvaccinated people, those who
RT @maricar_malinis: @PergamIC Yes, completely agree. Host factors need to be taken into consideration.#RealTimeVaccineChat
RT @Dr_Mike_Stevens: @RealTimeCOVID19 A6. Being vaccinated for #COVID19 helps you get a little closer back to a pre-pandemic life. See this

The new CDC guidance here is very helpful for the general public. But again if you are immunocompromised - I tell these patients to remain cautious. We need herd immunity to protect the most vulnerable and why need more vaccinated. #RealTimeVaccineChat https://t.co/elH7zUfmOp

The fact that JJ is back and in use will help to get more Americans vaccinated. Having a single dose vaccine has major advantages. The key is that the clotting is exceedinly rare ~1 in 1 million. And risk of clotting if you get COVID10 is much higher #RealTimeVaccineChat https://t.co/zCFW3ARD9G
RT @Dr_Mike_Stevens: @RealTimeCOVID19 A5. The #JohnsonandJohnson #COVID19 vaccine is associated w/ VERY rare risk of thrombosis w/ thrombo
@JGPharmD @mhtwt Like this idea too @JGPharmD It may be that one is better than another for particular patients populations. But for now - get the first one available to you! #RealTimeVaccineChat

@SICUPharmD @RealTimeCOVID19 @SCCM I am cautious about this interpretation as the JJ vaccine is the only one studied directly in South Africa. The data for mRNA vaccines is laboratory neutralization so isn't the same thing - plus JJ still protected against major complications with B.1.351 #RealTimeVaccineChat
@mhtwt @JGPharmD Great question - currently with the need to get vaccines out to everyone that is the first goal. Studies are definitely ongoing to address this #RealTimeVaccineChat
RT @AndrewPaviaMD: A2 The good news is that being on cancer chemotherapy, rheumatologic drugs, or any other immune compromising condition i

A2: Finally, to close the loop on this question. Immunosuppressed patients should continue to mask up, social distance and avoid crowds. Being cautious is key. Frustrating (I get it) but crucial #RealTimeVaccineChat

A2: For immunosuppressed patients it is also key to get family, caregivers, household members and close contacts vaccinated as this can be key to protection if they don't respond as well to vaccination. See here https://t.co/lnNBfcF47w #RealTimeVaccineChat
too much to say so couldn't add #RealTimeVaccineChat

A2: The data is still out for all patients, but vaccine responses in imnumosuppressed patients will not be at levels of the general public. However - getting vaccinated is still key for these patients populations @NCCN guidelines for cancer patients here https://t.co/t7m1YfkKyX https://t.co/Ch7D1dAcQu
A bit late - Steve Pergam, MD, MPH from @fredhutch representing the immunocompromised host - great to talk to #COVID19Vaccines #RTLNVaccineChat
